Key Match Events: Ghana's Djiku scored in the 56th minute.
Cape Verde's Monteiro scored in the 17th minute.
Cape Verde's Rodrigues scored in the 90+2 minute.
Ghana's Djiku received a yellow card in the 10th minute.
Ghana's Baba received a yellow card in the 48th minute.
Ghana's Paintsil received a yellow card in the 54th minute.
Cape Verde's Duarte received a yellow card in the 64th minute.
Cape Verde's Rocha Santos received a yellow card in the 74th minute.
Cape Verde's Rodrigues received a yellow card in the 90+3 minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Ghana's bid for a fifth Africa Cup of Nations title begins on Sunday, when they take on Cape Verde in the second game of Group B.
Ghana's early group-stage exit at the previous Cup of Nations was a low point for the four-time African champions.
Mohammed Kudus starred in Qatar and is anticipated to carry the can for the four-time winners.
Cape Verde should fear nothing in Sunday's fixture, with the Blue Sharks the type of opponent to make the Black Stars uncomfortable.
Cape Verde having eight different goalscorers in qualifying suggests they are a team who do not rely on one player to deliver the goods.
